Subject: Re: [junit] Asserting object equality=

            On Tuesday 03 March 20=
09 06:58:41 pm rognedaerzula wrote:

> Hi Everyone,

> 

> can anyone tell =
me how to assert equality of two objects such as array

> of bytes 

> or F=
iles in junit 3.8.1?

> 

> using 

> Assert.assertEquals(File1, File2) or =
assertEquals(bytearray1,

> bytearray2) always states that objects are not =
equal..

> 

> is this method supposed to compare 'content' or that it is a=
ctually

> referincing same object? - there is an assertSame method - so wo=
uld think

> assertEquals should compare content



It does, but to do so i=
t uses the objects .equals() method (how else?),

so it requires that that =
method do something sensible. If it doesn't,

you'll probably end up writin=
g your own method:



public void assertMyEqualsForFilesOrWhatever( Thing e=
xp, Thing act )

    {

    if (!mySuitableEqualityTest( exp, act ))

     =
   fail( mySuitableDifferenceMessage( exp, act ) );

    }
